step.title: Step One: Identify Urgent or Emergent Conditions
step.content:
Indicators for immediate emergency evaluation and treatment:

  • Current altered consciousness
  • Progressively declining neurological exam
  • Pupillary asymmetry
  • Seizures
  • Repeated vomiting
  • Double vision
  • Worsening headache
  • Cannot recognize people or disoriented to place
  • Behaves unusually or confused and irritable
  • Slurred speech
  • Unsteady on feet
  • Weakness or numbness in arms/legs
Note:
  • If person is currently deployed, follow guidance for management of mild TBI in deployed setting
  • If person presents immediately after injury (< seven days), then follow local guidance or emergency department (ED) protocols

step.title: Step Two: Evaluate for Diagnosis of Mild TBI
step.content:
• Loss of or decreased level of consciousness (< 30 minutes)
  • Loss of memory for events immediately before or after injury (≤ 24 hrs)
  • Alteration of consciousness/mental state (≤ 24 hrs)
  • Normal structural computerized axial tomography (CT) imaging
  • GCS Score: 13–15 (best value within first 24 hours if available)

Note: If diagnosis is moderate or severe TBI, exit this algorithm

step.title: Step Three: Identify if Related Symptoms are Present
step.content:
Physical

  • Headache
  • Dizziness
  • Balance disorder
  • Nausea
  • Fatigue
  • Sleep disturbance
  • Blurred vision
  • Light sensitivity
  • Hearing loss
  • Noise sensitivity
  • Seizures
  • Transient neurological abnormalities
  • Numbness and tingling

Cognitive

Difficulties with:
  • Attention
  • Concentration
  • Memory
  • Processing speed
  • Judgment
  • Executive control

Behavioral/Emotional

  • Depression
  • Anxiety
  • Agitation
  • Irritability
  • Impulsivity
  • Aggression

step.title: Step Four: Determine if Symptoms are Related to Mild TBI
step.content:
Symptoms present, related and on treatment

Refer to Algorithm C: Follow-up of Persistent Symptoms

Symptoms present, related and not on treatment

Refer to Algorithm B: Management of Symptoms

Symptoms present but unrelated

  • Provide education and access information
  • Screen for
    • Stress disorders
    • Substance use disorders
    • Mental health conditions
  • Follow up as indicated
